summary: The bill, officially named the Hindering Oppressive Nations from Obtaining Revenue Act (HONOR Act), aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It seeks to deny foreign tax credits and deductions for taxes paid or accrued to the Russian Federation. This denial would be in effect from 30 days after enactment until normal trade relations are restored. The bill also specifies effective dates for these changes and asserts they should be applied regardless of existing treaties.
